email_content:
Hi Sarah,

Great to hear that plans for the “Quantum Cohesion 2023” retreat are underway! I’ve pulled together a few ideas that marry fun with the specific team-bonding needs that surfaced in our recent evaluations.

Key feedback to keep in mind
• Adaptability is a clear team strength—people like Mark Thompson excel when the goal posts move.
• Inter-departmental communication is the main growth area. Several reviewers asked for more opportunities to practise clear, cross-functional dialogue.

With that in mind, here are four activities I think would hit the mark:

1. Quantum Puzzle Pursuit (90 min)
   A custom “escape-room on wheels” with quantum-themed challenges. Small, mixed-function teams solve sequential puzzles that require active knowledge-sharing. Built-in debrief highlights which communication patterns worked and why.

2. Futures Canvas Strategy Workshop (2 hrs)
   Using a large visual canvas, teams map our 3-year quantum roadmap, identify blockers and co-create quick experiments. This channels the team’s adaptability while exercising strategic thinking. Mark could co-facilitate the breakout centred on strategic pivots—he’ll shine here.

3. Communication Role-Play Circuit (1 hr)
   Rotating pairs act out common cross-team scenarios we’ve struggled with (handoffs, last-minute scope changes, etc.). We break after each round to share “What I heard / What I meant.” Simple but powerful for surfacing blind spots.

4. Trail Quest & Reflection Circles (half-day)
   Light hiking with geo-cached problem stations. Each stop poses a cooperative challenge, followed by 5-minute reflection circles. It blends movement, problem-solving and open dialogue in a natural setting.

Logistics notes
• All activities are portable and can be run onsite or at a nearby outdoor venue.
• I have draft run-sheets and material lists ready—happy to share.
• If budget allows, a professional facilitator for the role-play circuit would maximize impact (≈$800 half-day).

Let me know which of these resonates, and I can flesh out full agendas or vendor options. Excited to help make this retreat engaging and valuable!

Best,
John
